scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The David Ramsay photograph collection is comprised of four black-and-white photographs. Two photographs date from circa 1930 and pertain to the construction of the New York City subway. Included is an exterior view of elevated subway line construction at 4th Avenue and 9th Street in Brooklyn and an interior view of underground subway construction showing two excavation workers in a subway tunnel. The donor identified the location of the tunnel as, "probably 8th Avenue." The remaining two photographs are modern copy prints of illustrations. One copy print depicts an advertisement for Wechsler & Abraham, a large dry goods store that was located on Fulton Street in Brooklyn. The second copy print shows an illustration of an interior view of "the New England Kitchen at the great Sanitary Fair in aid of the soldiers during the Civil War, 1865."
